alert.note: Alert for Pima (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 26 at 10:25PM MST until July 26 at 10:45PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of South Central Arizona, including the following county, Pima. * WHEN...Until 1145 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1021 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms earlier in the evening. This will cause small stream flooding and flooding in poor drainage areas. Doppler radar has also indicated that rain has ended and between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Marana, Three Points, Avra Valley, Saguaro National Park West, Tucson Estates, Picture Rocks, San Pedro and Queens Well. - http://www.floodsafety.noaa.gov
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
